title: How to Bake a Vanilla Mirror Glaze Cake

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit or 204 degrees Celsius.
Spread butter onto an eight-inch cake pan with a silicon spatula.
Whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl.
Add the butter one teaspoon at time, while mixing with an electric mixer, at low speed, until ½ cup of butter is added.
Keep the blender on as you slowly add the sugar to the mixture.
Add both eggs one at a time and blend well.
Pour the vanilla extract and milk into the mix and increase the speed of the mixer to high, until all the ingredients are combined.
Pour the cake batter into the cake pan and put it in the oven for about 30-35 minutes to bake.
Allow the cake to cool off for about 15 minutes.
steps.description: Prepare the glaze, as the cake cooks.

steps.headline: Mix the gelatin with ¼ cup of water in a small bowl until it turns into a paste.
Take a separate larger bowl and pour a ½ cup white chocolate into it.
steps.description: Mix until it completely melts and becomes paste-like.

steps.headline: Add ⅓ cup of condensed milk into the larger bowl and mix.
Add the gelatin to it while continuing to mix.
Add ¼ cup of water, ½ cup of sugar, and a ½ cup of glucose syrup into a pot.
Heat the mixture until it boils to 100 degrees Fahrenheit or 37 degrees Celsius.
steps.description: Monitor the temperature with a thermometer.

steps.headline: Add this mixture to the large bowl of white chocolate and use a blender to blend it.
Add the food coloring of your choice and mix well with a spoon.
Let it sit in the refrigerator for about 12 hours.
Place cake onto a wire rack and allow it to cook for 5-10 minutes.
steps.description: Store in a closed container. To make the cake easier to remove, use a butter knife and go around the edge. Turn the cake pan upside down to release the cake.

steps.headline: Remove the mixture from the container and let it sit at room temperature.
Place the cake on a rotating dish, and slowly pour the glaze while constantly rotating the dish.
Enjoy!

text: Baking the Cake Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit or 204 degrees Celsius.  Spread butter onto an eight-inch cake pan with a silicon spatula.  Whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl.  Add the butter one teaspoon at time, while mixing with an electric mixer, at low speed, until ½ cup of butter is added.  Keep the blender on as you slowly add the sugar to the mixture.  Add both eggs one at a time and blend well.  Pour the vanilla extract and milk into the mix and increase the speed of the mixer to high, until all the ingredients are combined.  Pour the cake batter into the cake pan and put it in the oven for about 30-35 minutes to bake.  Allow the cake to cool off for about 15 minutes. Prepare the glaze, as the cake cooks. Making the Glaze and Serving Mix the gelatin with ¼ cup of water in a small bowl until it turns into a paste.  Take a separate larger bowl and pour a ½ cup white chocolate into it. Mix until it completely melts and becomes paste-like. Add ⅓ cup of condensed milk into the larger bowl and mix.  Add the gelatin to it while continuing to mix.  Add ¼ cup of water, ½ cup of sugar, and a ½ cup of glucose syrup into a pot.  Heat the mixture until it boils to 100 degrees Fahrenheit or 37 degrees Celsius. Monitor the temperature with a thermometer. Add this mixture to the large bowl of white chocolate and use a blender to blend it.  Add the food coloring of your choice and mix well with a spoon.  Let it sit in the refrigerator for about 12 hours.  Place cake onto a wire rack and allow it to cook for 5-10 minutes. Store in a closed container. To make the cake easier to remove, use a butter knife and go around the edge. Turn the cake pan upside down to release the cake. Remove the mixture from the container and let it sit at room temperature.  Place the cake on a rotating dish, and slowly pour the glaze while constantly rotating the dish.  Enjoy!
